message.content: This question tests basic knowledge about the Earth's rotation. One full rotation on Earth's axis takes approximately 24 hours or 1440 minutes. Option (A) is too short of a time period for a full rotation. Option (B) is incorrect because a month is approximately 30-31 days, which is much longer than a rotation. Option (C) is half of the correct answer, as it takes 24 hours for a full rotation, not 2 days.

This question requires basic knowledge about the rotation of the Earth. One full rotation on Earth's axis takes approximately 24 hours, which is equivalent to 1440 minutes. Option (A) is incorrect because 12 hours is only half of a full rotation. Option (B) is incorrect because 1 month is approximately 30 days, which is longer than the time it takes for one full rotation. Option (C) is incorrect because 2 days is only two-thirds of a full rotation.

Option (C) is incorrect because it only accounts for one full rotation, not a complete day.
